alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 30 at 2:34AM PDT until August 03 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM NOON PDT TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Isolated thunderstorms possible at the beaches this weekend. Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf expected from Sunday night through Wednesday. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands. * WHEN...From noon PDT today through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The threat of lightning may prompt beach closures. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
